body: In the following reports, the ''listed at'' price is the asking price when negotiations began that ended in the sale. Time on market is from the most recent listing to contract. body: THE tenants living in a year-old apartment building called the Bristol in the Flushing section of Queens include a 26-year-old registered nurse free from the parental nest for the first time, a 45-year-old teacher who left her husband as well as her apartment when she moved to the Bristol with her two young children, and a Chinese astrologer. The
title: PERSPECTIVES; Priming the Pump for New Middle-Income Housing

body: Jeff Hasler says Prospect Park has become an integral part of his life. He has dressed up like a monster to entertain youngsters during the annual Halloween walk. He and his wife, Cheryl, often take walks in the Long Meadow when they need to discuss important things. And just sitting on a bench on a Sunday is one of the pleasures of his life.
title: Two Shootings Cast a Pall Over a Cherished Haven

body: HOWARD PRINCE and Lucille Poirier bought their three-story brick building in the Carroll Gardens section of Brooklyn as much for the neighborhood as for the possibilities the structure possessed. ''The whole house was a tenement,'' said Mr. Prince, recalling that its curb appeal consisted of a mulberry tree dripping a blue mess around a chain-link
title: Habitats/58 Fourth Place in Carroll Gardens; Work Seemed Cosmetic -- Until 'Black Friday'

body: ''THIS is a tragedy!'' Ed Levine moans, craning his neck as the car speeds down Neptune Avenue in Brooklyn. ''Did you see that? There's a FOR RENT sign in Gerace's bakery. It can't be!'' He begins a keening wail, a lament for a lost bakery. ''Oh, my God. This drives me crazy. That place has been in Coney Island forever. They taught me how to make
title: Critic's Notebook; On an Odyssey With the Homer Of Rugelach

body: To the Editor: When I read the article about the basketball team that I own, the Brooklyn Bounce, I was surprised that it focused on an unhappy matter from my past (''Hoop Dream for an Owner,'' Oct. 26). In giving interviews, I always state that my law license was taken away in 1987. When I began to discuss this matter with your reporter, he waved
title: Deepening the Great Divide; Why Focus on Negative In Writing on Team?

body: Tonight in Park Ridge, N.J., Scott Galdi's seasonal home improvements will have their ritual unveiling: 21 monsters, 3 homemade pine coffins, 2 smoke machines, tombstones dedicated to the 1997 Yankees and Diana, Princess of Wales, and a life-size, three-dimensional silhouette of the shower scene from ''Psycho,'' which adds that certain something to
title: The Festive Face of Halloween; With All-Out Displays, It's Creeping Up on Christmas

body: Big Deal 1016 FIFTH AVENUE $4 MILLION If Penthouse West really were the Spanish palace it was designed to look like, it would overlook a feudal domain. As it is, the 1,600-square-foot terrace overlooks Central Park -- the Reservoir, the Great Lawn and the cityscape to the west. It was bought by a woman involved in many New York charities, who plans
title: Residential Resales

body: Carroll Park, a placid haven of benches and ball courts in the heart of Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn, reflects the neighborhood's blend of Italian-American families and yuppie strivers. Old men play boccie there while newer arrivals hold wine-tastings to raise money to keep the park spruced up. But a group of black youths interviewed recently in Red
title: In Brooklyn, 2 Worlds on an Edge; At the Scene of a Bias Beating, a Line Divides Red Hook and Carroll Gardens

body: INTERNATIONAL 3-17 In Congo, Disappointment With Kabila Government The leader of Congo, Laurent Kabila, in office four months, has endured a jarring apprenticeship. And many Congolese feel let down. Wages have not been paid. The authorities have cracked down on protests, and have not made their aims clear. 1 Offer of Algerian Negotiations Pursuing
title: NEWS SUMMARY

body: A fourth suspect was arrested Wednesday night in what the authorities have termed a racially motivated assault on a black man by a group of whites in Brooklyn last Saturday morning. The new suspect, Ralph Mazzatto, 25, was accused of being the driver of a sports utility vehicle that hit the victim, Kevin Teague, 26, intentionally before the three
title: 4th Arrest in Bias Attack

body: A charge of attempted murder was added yesterday to earlier assault charges against three white teen-agers accused of what the authorities called the racial beating of a black man in Brooklyn on Saturday morning. The victim, Kevin Teague, 26, was beaten with a baseball bat, a metal steering-wheel lock and fists and feet after being intentionally
title: Attempted Murder Charge Is Added in a Beating Case

body: The arrests of three white teen-agers in the beating of a black man in Brooklyn over the weekend rekindled memories of a time when the brownstones of the largely white Carroll Gardens were considered off-limits to blacks from a housing project across the street, some residents said yesterday. ''There's not that much antagonizing of us'' nowadays,
title: Beating in Brooklyn Shatters Fragile Neighborhood Truce

body: AT THE MET -- Placido Domingo and, in the title role, Denyce Graves performed in ''Carmen'' last night before an audience at the Metropolitan Opera that included President and Mrs. Clinton. B6. TENSIONS REVISITED -- Residents of the Red Hook Houses in Brooklyn said the arrests of three white teen-agers in the beating of black man rekindled memories
title: INSIDE METRO

body: Three white teen-agers from Brooklyn were ordered held in $100,000 bail yesterday after they were arraigned on charges of beating a black man with a baseball bat and a steering-wheel lock early Saturday morning in what the authorities described as an apparent bias crime, officials said. The teen-agers -- Anthony Mascuzzio, 19, Alfonse Russo, 17,
title: 3 Teen-Agers Are Arraigned In an Attack

body: An Independent Bookshop Puts Focus on Brooklyn Nick Kaufmann and Phil Presby realized a mutual lifelong dream with the opening of Tell-Tale Books, their new shop in Brooklyn. Tell-Tale Books, at 314 Sackett Street in Carroll Gardens, offers new and used editions, mystery titles as well as fiction, nonfiction and children's literature. Tell-Tale
title: NEW YORKERS & CO.

body: IF there was one thing that New York City's community school boards could count on over the last quarter century -- if there was one constant that defined the realpolitik of education on the neighborhood level -- it was this: the school boards got to pick the principals. So it was no surprise when a school board member went to meet with the new
title: District Superintendents Are Supposed to Change the Public Schools. Can They?

body: OVER the last three weeks Margaux Jones-McDuffie interviewed more than 50 people who were interested in taking the two apartments she had for rent in her three-family town house in Atlantic Center, the new mixed-use community under development in downtown Brooklyn. She and her husband, William McDuffie, and their four children have lived in their
title: Housing at Atlantic Center Nears a New Phase

body: There are no plans to bottle and market ''Eau de Gowanus,'' but efforts to revive interest in the canal-cum-cesspool between Park Slope and Carroll Gardens have reached new heights of creativity: sunset cruises on the waterway. The Brooklyn Center for the Urban Environment offered the first boat trip in June, hoping that exposing neighborhood
title: Evening Cruise on the Gowanus Canal, Clothespins Optional

body: ''I have a song here. . . .'' Dion swaggered across the stage, his trademark floppy cap bouncing lightly on a nest of curly dark hair, his palm flat against the strings of the electric guitar slung over his shoulder. ''I have a song here,'' he said again, his voice still thick with the Bronx, his attitude still straight off Belmont Avenue. With a
title: Still in Love, and the Love Still Grows

body: Gift Baskets Over the River Fraser-Morris, which has provided gift baskets, fancy groceries and delicacies to Upper East Side residents for nearly 75 years, has moved from 1264 Third Avenue (73d Street) to 102 President Street (Hicks Street), Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn. For the next month or two, the company will offer its gift basket and wholesale
title: Food Notes

body: The 600 nurses at Long Island College Hospital in Brooklyn have postponed a strike that was to begin at 7 A.M. today. The union delayed the strike because it had expected to resume negotiations at a meeting on Monday with a Federal mediator. But hospital officials did not show up for the meeting. ''This is clearly part of their stand, which is
title: Nurses' Strike Is Delayed in Hope of New Talks

body: In a labor dispute that is being closely watched by other hospitals intent on cutting costs, 600 nurses at the Long Island College Hospital in Brooklyn have voted to go on strike beginning Wednesday as they resist the hospital's decision to cut the salaries of many nurses as a way to help stay afloat. The dispute at the 551-bed hospital indicates
title: In Brooklyn, Nurses Vote To Walk Out

body: A Food Family Grows to Three Boroughs Raymond Vivola, who was born in Sardinia, Italy, and raised in Brooklyn, has always loved food. Nineteen years ago, Mr. Vivola opened his first store, Fratelli Ravioli on Court Street in Carroll Gardens, stocking specialty Italian food, including homemade ravioli and other homemade pastas and sauces. He passed
title: NEW YORKERS & CO.

body: In Chinatown, which in years past has been transformed into a sort of pyrotechnics emporium in the days leading up to the Fourth of July, a steady stream of hapless teen-agers paraded up and down yesterday searching vainly for fireworks, or at least a firecracker or a sparkler. Vendors sold ginger and ginseng, jade pendants and Puerto Rican flag
title: Fireworks Sales Doused by City Crackdown

body: Replacing the Gowanus Expressway with a tunnel would be cheaper in the long run than rebuilding the crumbling elevated highway and would revive moribund neighborhoods in southwestern Brooklyn, according to a study by a private planning group. The study by the Regional Plan Association, to be formally released this morning, found that it would cost
title: Study Backs Tunnel to Replace the Gowanus

body: A caption on Thursday with a picture of two men dozing through the heat outside the Cappuccino House on Court Street in Carroll Gardens misstated the borough where it is located. It is in Brooklyn, not Queens.
title: Corrections

body: As the mercury rose yesterday, there was no place for Jose Espinal to be but outside, walking the streets of Elmhurst, Queens, searching for the merciful shade of trees. His one-room apartment has no air-conditioner, and neither does the senior center where he has breakfast and lunch every day. The subway platform where he stands every afternoon to
title: Sweating Out All 93 Degrees of Hottest Day Yet

body: The letter, addressed ''Dear Student Musician,'' was tucked inside a case that arrived in late January at the Manhattan offices of VH1, the music-video network. ''I played this trombone in the 1960's and 70's with Lionel Hampton, Woody Herman and many other great musicians including Duke Ellington,'' wrote Vince Prudente. ''While this trombone has
title: For City Schools, Melody in the Mail

body: Miro has always craved exercise. He is an 8-year-old Saluki, a breed of dog related to the greyhound. But when he moved to Carroll Gardens from Midwood, where he had a yard, four years ago, something inside of him died. ''He kind of wilted,'' said Alyssa Bonilla, who owns Miro. ''He didn't have enough space to run.'' Now he does. Two weeks ago,
title: Official Run Is a First for Brooklyn Dogs

body: A study commissioned by New York City has found that allowing rent increases once an apartment falls vacant, a policy recommended by Gov. George E. Pataki, would have a limited impact on the rent of most apartments during the next two years. But a few areas, including the Upper West Side, would see rent increases as high as 30 percent, the study
title: Rent Decontrol Study: From No Impact to 30% Increases

body: Gnocchi Hunger Plump little pillows of potato gnocchi can now be had with stylish fillings of porcini mushroom, asparagus, artichoke, spinach, cheese and pumpkin. They are imported from Italy, frozen, and take only five minutes or so to cook, straight from the freezer. The spinach variety is especially delicious, served with olive oil and a dusting
title: Food Notes

body: A subway token booth clerk narrowly escaped serious injury early yesterday when a gunman opened fire with a shotgun in what appeared to be a robbery attempt, the police said. The clerk, Donovan Ellis, 28, was working in the token booth at the Smith-Ninth Street station of the F and G lines in Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn, at 4:45 A.M. when the gunman
title: Gunman Fires Into Booth But Misses Token Clerk

body: When Raymond Leone was growing up in Brooklyn's Carroll Gardens, he was known for his many pets. He had dogs, cats, a pony, rabbits, chickens, ducks, turtles and a raccoon. When they would die, he would make little coffins from scraps of lumber and bury them in his backyard. So Mr. Leone, who is now 35, became an undertaker in the family business,
title: Parlor Where a Beloved Pet Can Go Out in Style

body: To the Editor: Aggressive dogs are usually the result of improper training and are not created by dog runs. On the contrary, dog runs are an invaluable aid in the socialization of dogs (and their owners). We encourage the Parks Department to develop additional runs as well as sponsor training classe so people can be educated in the proper handling
title: Owners, Not Dogs, Are Problem at Dog Runs

body: IT'S another Saturday morning and Dan MacGowan, coffee cup at hand, is once again hunched at his desk, poring over the real estate listings. Kathy MacGowan, no longer an ardent adherent to this ritual, sits nearby, reading something -- anything! -- that does not have to do with apartment hunting. So it has been for too many weekends in the
title: In Much of the City, A Robust Market

body: For 16 years, several neighborhoods strung along the Brooklyn waterfront were represented in the State Assembly by Eileen C. title: Special Election Tomorrow to Fill Assembly and Council Seats

body: As housing prices in Manhattan continue to climb, the Brooklyn town house market has started to soar, not only in Brooklyn Heights but also in nearby Cobble Hill, where houses are starting to sell for more than $1 million, a record for the neighborhood. At the same time, the number of houses being sold has also shot up, with one broker saying his
title: In Brooklyn Neighborhoods, Market for Town Houses Soars

body: THE MEL GIBSON thriller ''Ransom'' was on the screen in a midtown Manhattan theater and, farfetched though the story may be, I was buying it all. That is to say, I was properly suspending disbelief in exchange for a couple of hours of escapist entertainment, in this case about an hour and 45 minutes of rising suspense followed by 15 of cathartic
title: It's New York, but Not Really
